article: In 1945,a 12-year-old boy, Reuben, saw something in a shop window that set his heart _ .But the price - five dollars - was _ his means. That day he found two sacks, which he took to the factory and sold.The boy's hand _ grasped the five-cent coins as he ran the two kilometers home.Reuben found an empty soda tin and dropped his coins inside.Then he _ the tin beneath a pile of sweet smelling hay .  It was dinnertime _ Reuben got home.His mother, Dora, was at the kitchen stove, ready to serve dinner as Reuben took his place at the table.He looked at his mother and smiled.Slim and beautiful, she was the _ of the home, the glue that held it together.  Every day after school, Reuben searched the town, _ the hessian sacks.All summer long, Reuben continued his _ task.Then all too soon the garden was harvested, the leaves _ and the winds blew cold.Reuben wandered the streets, _ searching for his Hessian treasures.Often he was _ , tired and hungry, but the thought of the object in the shop window kept him going,  Finally spring burst into glorious green and Reuben's spirits erupted.The time had come! Here" Reuben called loudly as he ran to her side.He placed a small box in her work-roughened hand.She unwrapped it _ , not to break the packing paper.A beautiful jewel box appeared.Dora opened the box, tears beginning to fill her eyes.On a small brooch was the word Mother, in gold letters.
